title: Default codestart setting of custom Quarkus platform is ignored
body:
### Describe the bug

According to some of the examples there appears to be a `default-codestart` project metadata, which can be set in the platform descriptor. Example: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/584949120273927e871b698622a63f0fee71ee0f/devtools/bom-descriptor-json/src/main/resources/catalog-overrides.json#L142

However, this appears to be ignored when creating a new project using the Quarkus CLI (`quarkus create app`). Instead the following method gets called, which always returns the RESTEasy codestart (or RESTEasy Reactive codestart, depending on the Quarkus version): https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/584949120273927e871b698622a63f0fee71ee0f/independent-projects/tools/devtools-common/src/main/java/io/quarkus/devtools/codestarts/quarkus/QuarkusCodestartCatalog.java#L180-L204

### Expected behavior

There should be a way using which a platform can override the default codestart.

### Actual behavior

See description.

### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

_No response_
